pros: Excellent pharmacists, pharmacy techs, respiratory team. They are a great resource.
cons: Horrible management. Chief nursing officer: horrible. This man has so much pride and ego. When he was present during codes, he would just say commands with his nose up in the air, did not help staff that needed his assistance. Just horrible management skills. I can’t believe they keep promoting this incompetent man.

pros: Generally ED staff are easy to get along with
cons: No room for advancement and no good benefits

review_title: Horrible place to work - Most Doctors Leave
pros:
Historic Icon
Local staff is invested
cons:
Risk to medical license daily due to mistakes by MAs and mismanagement by clinic manager and gross mismanagement by Administrators and HR. The MAs do their best but there is no training for them and they are overwhelmed, high turn over. Clinic management is nonexistent, not fully trained in day to day organization and triage of patients. 

Uses the worst EHR that does not transfer orders, most orders are done with paper that changes hands 5 times and 20-25% of the orders get lost. I left to protect my medical license. Management is not local and does not care about staff nor patients and does not change or update based on clinicians protests to urgently make changes to protect patients. Administration has said they would get a new EHR for the last 4 years. They just promise and do not follow through. 

Every primary care doctor (with one exception) has left this place and most of the NPs and PAs have as well. They violated the California Medical Board's law against corporate practice of medicine on multiple occasions, I brought this to their attention, they don't care. I have also heard second hand questionable practices of breaking Stark Law.

The building is so old I know of at least 3 providers who have lung issues after working in the clinic, they decided to re-paint the molded walls when I complained with a potential law suit - did not fix the problem.

Clinicians are very drained after even a 4 day work week - VERY HIGH BURN OUT.

Avoid this place, maybe it will close and then someone will re-open with management who care about local patients.

Oh and I also found out they were paying me 35% less than the standard.

review_title: Please do not work here, do not seek medical care here
pros: The only pro of working at this facility was seeing what a poor and unsafe hospital looks like and allowing me to appreciate every job going forward from Glenn Medical.
cons: Please, if you are considering working here and you have a medical license of any type just move on. Your license will be in jeopardy every single day and it is not worth it. This hospital is run with little resources and no ability to train nurses. Patient safety is never a priority, only money made. Nurses frequently are out of ratio and bullied into unsafe situations. Patients are often treated poorly because of staffing issues, an outdated facility, and lack of experienced staff, think hospital rooms that are 90 degrees in the summer, cockroaches, bedsores, staff using porta potties, med errors. All situations I encountered daily. The HR department is a nightmare. This department will lie about wages, benefits, even hire employees without verifying licences. I wish none of this was true, and I truly encourage you to seek employment elsewhere, this is not a place you want to be wrapped up in. Glenn Medical is a sinking ship.
